duties_responsibilities.duty: Overseeing the provision of high-quality, family-centered spiritual care of patients, families, and team members.
Planning, organizing, staffing, and directing the overall management of Spiritual Care and Education.
Developing and implementing a more robust bereavement program, better integrating spiritual care within the organization, and rebuilding relationships with department staff.
Leading a team of direct reports and working to develop and implement a more robust bereavement program.
Working to better integrate spiritual care within the organization and rebuild relationships with department staff.

education_certification.credential: Master’s degree in Divinity, Ministry, Theology, or related field required.
Board Certified Chaplain from accepted certifying organization (APC, NAJC, NACC, ACPE) required.
